chapter.title: Preparing and Registering Clients
chapter.para: Client registration with SUSE Manager is executed with a bootstrap script on the server which deploys all necessary information to clients. The bootstrap script contains parameters which assigns a client system to its base channel. Two important parameters are:

formalpara.title: Activation Keys
formalpara.para: Activation keys can be managed from the web-GUI. These keys should be created and assigned to one of your previously added software channels. These keys act as identifiers for individual channels, and all client systems associated with a channel key receive updates from the channel its key was assigned to. By design a client may only be connected to one base channel through its activation or GPG key. This quick-start guide does not cover GPG key usage. For more information on using GPG Keys with Bootstrap see: Using Bootstrap with GPG Keys: Reference Guide For a list of client operating systems supported by SUSE Manager, refer to Section 3.1.2, “Supported Client Systems”.

listitem.para: Generate activation keys for both of your new client channels (SLES11 SP4 and SLES12 SP1)

sect1.title: What are Activation Keys?
sect1.para: Activation keys define the number of software entitlements, channels and groups a client system is allowed to subscribe to. This information is passed on to all systems registered with a key. Each activation key is bound to the organization for which it has been created. For this guide you will be using the default &susemgr; organization which includes all software entitlements.

note.title: Activation Keys for New Organizations
note.para: When creating activation keys for a new organization, assign system software entitlements first. The default organization includes all necessary entitlements. For more information, see also: “Organization Management: Reference Guide".

step.para: Log in to the SUSE Manager Web interface as administrator.
Switch to the Systems tab and select Activation Keys.
Click the Create New Key link at the upper right corner.
Enter a Description to identify the generated activation key.
Enter a human readable key string value such as: SLES12-SP1 .

warning.title: Allowed Characters
warning.para: Do not use commas within the key string. All other characters are allowed. Commas are used as separators when registering client systems with multiple activation keys with rhnreg_ks

step.para: Enter 5 in the Usage: field. This will allow up to 5 clients to register using this key.
Select the &sle; 12 SP1 channel you added earlier from the Base Channels: drop down.
Select the virtualization check box as an Add-on entitlement:.
Leave the Contact Method: at default.
Leave Universal Default unchecked. Click Create Activation key to finish creating the key for the first channel.

sect1.para: Repeat this procedure and create a key for the &sle; 11 SP4 channel and proceed to the next section.
